Expect extra measures of ripeness and complexity, thanks to a terrific vintage and prime-sited vines. A must try!","longDescription":"

Winemaking Franciscan monks knew it in 1797. Zinfandel-planting Italian immigrants knew it in 1920. And savvy Cab lovers know it today: Paso Robles is “one of the most dynamic wine regions in California” (Wine Spectator).

It’s an exciting time to get to know Paso wines for sure – not only are there dozens of serious, $100-plus-a-bottle wines emerging from top estates, but there are also terrific values to be had. And that’s especially true in a great vintage like 2013. (According to all the winemakers we’ve talked to, 2013 is another excellent vintage for California. High-quality fruit, richness, balance – there’s a lot to appreciate.) And The Holdings is a delicious introduction.

This exclusive release comes from a talented local grower and three, top-sited vineyards in eastern Paso Robles. Look for distinctive blackberry aromas and rich palate, with flavors of ripe blueberry, velvety, polished tannins and a long finish. Drinking deliciously now, The Holdings is best ‘held’ until you’re serving a nice, juicy steak. Lock down your share today!","webHeadline":"Excellent Vintage Paso Robles Cab","styleName":"Red - Full bodied","styleId":"RedE","grapeName":"Cabernet Sauvignon","grapeId":"1","appellationName":"Paso Robles","appellationId":"US0008","regionName":"California","regionId":"015","countryName":"USA","countryId":"US","colourName":"Red","colourId":"Red","vintage":"2013","smallImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_S.jpg","largeImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_L.jpg","thumbnailImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_T.jpg","lowestPricePerBottle":15.83,"enPrimeurFlag":false,"accolades":[],"vppQualifier":true,"mixed":false},"userItemDetails":{"sortPriority":0,"recommendationTypeId":100,"new":true},"whereUsed":{"inFavourites":false,"inPurchaseHistory":false,"inUserRatedWines":false,"inRecentlyBrowsedList":false,"inRecommendationsList":false}},{"product":{"skus":[{"id":"sku2690261","itemCode":"0125013","listPrice":13.99,"salePrice":13.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":1,"salePricePerBottle":13.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2690396","itemCode":"B0125013","listPrice":83.94,"salePrice":83.94,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":6,"salePricePerBottle":13.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2690384","itemCode":"C0125013","listPrice":167.88,"salePrice":166.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":12,"salePricePerBottle":13.92,"vppApplier":false}],"id":"prod2430078","itemCode":"0125013","name":"The Waxed Bat","description":"Argentina’s deep, dark reds are big news right now. Few are bigger than Opi Sadler’s acclaimed blend of Shiraz, Cabernet and Malbec. Packed with black fruit and made for steak.","longDescription":"

The Waxed Bat is always a huge hit with customers, show judges and critics. And today, you get to taste for yourself (if you're quick enough).

Opi Sadler is one talented winemaker. His colleagues have nicknamed him "The Magician," thanks to his uncanny ability to draw out the most magical qualities in grapes – a talent that's helped put the fine wine spotlight on Argentina. His Waxed Bat is even more special – vintage after vintage, Opi conjures up this acclaimed blend of berry-rich Shiraz, inky-black Malbec and chocolaty Cabernet. This 2013 is every bit as sumptuous and dark as his previous releases and (no surprise) is already garnering acclaim from top competitions like the International Wine Challenge.

A single sip will reveal why Decanter World Wine Awards judges described past vintages as “so thick you could paint with it.” Expect a deep, dark glassful, starting with aromas of lush blackberry and notes of violet, smoke, pepper and licorice. On the palate, layers of rich black fruit flavor and oaky complexity. Look for that trademark long, smooth finish. Delicious with a big, juicy cut of steak.

Another Opi trademark? Small batches. Which means we recommend you get your share ordered today.

Made with premium Snipes Mountain fruit, this rich Cab is not to be missed.","longDescription":"

Cellar-worthy NEW exclusive from the King of Washington Wine

Charles Smith is a huge name. “The man is a brilliant winemaker who knows where all the best fruit is hidden,” says The Wine Advocate. Wine & Spirits has named his K Vintners a “Best New Winery of the Last Ten Years.” And, this Food & Wine “Winemaker of the Year” is among the few whose wines boast 99 Parker points. Like his Royal City Syrah, which costs $140 and must be reserved in advance. Then there’s his Cabernet, described by the UK Press Association as “too good to share.”

When we first tried Charles’ wines in 2009 (from barrels in his garage), we knew they were fantastic values. At that time he didn’t do exclusive labels. He does now, but only for us – and they’re always a big hit. Made with world-class fruit from premium Snipes Mountain, this age-worthy 2012 may be his best Cab yet – 90 Points from Wine Spectator makes our case on that claim. Along with this delicious-sounding tasting note:

Focused, complex and inviting, with green olive, sassafras and coffee accents to the blackberry and currant fruit, mingling effortlessly against refined tannins on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2020.

Decant to unleash the full range of intense black-fruit flavors, then serve with a special dinner (Charles recommends succulent roast beef). Enjoy now, or to 2019.

Guaranteed to sell fast. Order now.

Look forward to dark, sun-baked fruit with hints of freshly brewed coffee and toasty oak.","longDescription":"

“Paolo Masi makes wines with irreproachably clean fruit and abundant personality,” says top Italian wine guide Gambero Rosso. His "lipsmacking, amazing value" Super Tuscan is made in small quantities – so we snapped up all we could of his delicious 2011.

The ambitious, quality-driven Paolo Masi is definitely at the top of his game, with plaudits from major critics like Robert Parker. And thanks to a 20-plus-year relationship with his family’s small estate, you enjoy exclusive access to his small-batch "Super Tuscan." This rich style blends native Tuscan grapes with international varieties like Cabernet Sauvignon. Acclaimed wine writer Natalie MacLean called Paolo's 2007 blend of half Sangiovese and half Cabernet "lipsmacking delicious. Such an amazing wine for the money." Thanks to another great vintage in Tuscany, you can expect more of the same from this 2011.

The wine’s name, "Verso Cielo," is a nod to Paolo's special vineyards, which he planted "facing skyward" in the hills of the premium Chianti sub-zone, Rufina. This ideal exposure helps grapes soak up lots of sun, which yields fuller, more robust flavors in the glass. A generous, 14-month slumber in fine oak adds even greater complexity. Look for deep aromas and flavors of sun-baked raisin and blackberry – plus notes of black currant, strawberry and hints of freshly brewed coffee and toasty oak.

Paolo only makes a few barrels of this special red – so early orders are highly recommended.

","webHeadline":"Star Winemaker's Rare Super Tuscan","styleName":"Red - Medium to full bodied","styleId":"RedD","grapeName":"Red Blend","grapeId":"15","appellationName":"Toscana IGT","appellationId":"IT0018","regionName":"Tuscany","regionId":"091","countryName":"Italy","countryId":"IT","colourName":"Red","colourId":"Red","vintage":"2011","smallImage":"/images/us/en/product/0272211_S.jpg","largeImage":"/images/us/en/product/0272211_L.jpg","thumbnailImage":"/images/us/en/product/0272211_T.jpg","lowestPricePerBottle":19.92,"enPrimeurFlag":false,"accolades":[],"vppQualifier":true,"mixed":false},"userItemDetails":{"sortPriority":0,"recommendationTypeId":100,"new":true},"whereUsed":{"inFavourites":false,"inPurchaseHistory":false,"inUserRatedWines":false,"inRecentlyBrowsedList":false,"inRecommendationsList":false},"ratingDetails":{"productRating":{"avgRating":3.3,"numberOfReviews":4}}},{"product":{"skus":[{"id":"sku2011298","itemCode":"0302911","listPrice":34.99,"salePrice":34.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":1,"salePricePerBottle":34.99,"vppApplier":true,"vppPrice":31.49,"vppDiscountPct":10.0},{"id":"sku2011302","itemCode":"B0302911","listPrice":209.94,"salePrice":209.94,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":6,"salePricePerBottle":34.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2011303","itemCode":"C0302911","listPrice":419.88,"salePrice":418.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":12,"salePricePerBottle":34.92,"vppApplier":false}],"id":"prod1770561","itemCode":"0302911","name":"Domaine de Nalys Dix Salmees Chateauneuf du Pape","description":"Magnificent, top-of-the-range Châteauneuf-du-Pape from the acclaimed Domaine de Nalys – makers of “disarmingly lush, seductive and delicious” reds, says Robert Parker.","longDescription":"

Without question, the crown jewel of the southern Rhône is the village of Châteauneuf-du-Pape. Its legendary reds are the kind of powerful yet elegant wines that inspire a life-long devotion (just ask Robert Parker, who fell in love with wine after a bottle of Châteauneuf).

If you haven’t tried one, now is the time. The Rhône has been on a roll with a string of great vintages, most recently near-perfect, 98-point (Wine Spectator) 2010 – one of “the two greatest vintages I have ever tasted in thirty-three years of visiting the region,” says Robert Parker. Speaking of the top critic’s favorite spots, he has high praise for the renowned estate that made this beauty: "Domaine de Nalys is excellent — its reds are disarmingly lush, seductive and delicious.”

Made with all thirteen permitted Châteauneuf grape varieties, this special cuvée fits the bill perfectly. Get ready for exceptional flavor complexity — rich, silky red and black fruit (raspberries, blackberries, cherries) layered with delicate spice nuances, followed by a long, satiny finish. A guaranteed big hit – enjoy now, or to 2017.

Don’t miss Aldo’s world-class Chardonnay Reserva.","longDescription":"

“Aldo Olivier’s Viña Falernia is a pioneering, maverick winery, single-handedly responsible for putting Elqui on Chile’s fine-wine map.” (Peter Richards, Wines of Chile)

High praise for sure. Almost as high as Aldo’s remote Elqui Valley vineyards. They’re some of the world’s tallest (at 6,000 ft.). And at those heights, brilliant sunshine and the cooling influence of the famous Humboldt Current (from the nearby Pacific Ocean) add remarkable flavor intensity and a mountain-fresh zing to his Chardonnay.

Aldo’s trophy cabinet is pretty tall too — it needs to be, in order to house all his accolades. Recent additions include Trophy and gold from the all-important Decanter World Wine Awards in 2012. You’ll also find ‘Best in Show’ titles from the Wines of Chile Awards and dozens of other gold medals.

See for yourself what the buzz is all about. Crafted with premium fruit from Aldo’s special Titon Vineyard (one of the coolest in Elqui), this wine is brimming with enticing papaya and vanilla, with a round, creamy finish (courtesy of six months in fine French oak). Serve lightly chilled and enjoy with roast chicken, grilled salmon, or a spread of creamy aged cheeses.

Rare value on a world-class, single-vineyard Chardonnay. Order now.

","webHeadline":"'Pioneering' Chilean Chardonnay","styleName":"White - Dry","styleId":"Wht2","grapeName":"Chardonnay","grapeId":"3","appellationName":"Elqui Valley","appellationId":"CL0000","regionName":"Elqui Valley","regionId":"032","countryName":"Chile","countryId":"CL","colourName":"White","colourId":"White","vintage":"2012","smallImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332112_S.jpg","largeImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332112_L.jpg","thumbnailImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332112_T.jpg","lowestPricePerBottle":14.92,"enPrimeurFlag":false,"accolades":[],"vppQualifier":true,"mixed":false},"userItemDetails":{"sortPriority":0,"recommendationTypeId":100,"new":true},"whereUsed":{"inFavourites":false,"inPurchaseHistory":false,"inUserRatedWines":false,"inRecentlyBrowsedList":false,"inRecommendationsList":false},"ratingDetails":{"productRating":{"avgRating":3.5,"numberOfReviews":2}}},{"product":{"skus":[{"id":"sku2730468","itemCode":"0332612","listPrice":16.99,"salePrice":16.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":1,"salePricePerBottle":16.99,"vppApplier":true,"vppPrice":15.29,"vppDiscountPct":10.0},{"id":"sku2730492","itemCode":"B0332612","listPrice":101.94,"salePrice":101.94,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":6,"salePricePerBottle":16.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2730485","itemCode":"C0332612","listPrice":203.88,"salePrice":202.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":12,"salePricePerBottle":16.92,"vppApplier":false}],"id":"prod2470186","itemCode":"0332612","name":"Sonoma Vineyards Chardonnay","description":"Truly sunshine in a glass from one of the state's first (and largest) solar-powered wineries and Wine Enthusiast’s 2013 American Winery of the Year. A perfect, citrus-charged partner for seafood, chicken or vegetarian feasts.","longDescription":"

Rodney Strong Vineyards is on a roll.

First, there’s the estate itself. On top of being one of the world’s largest solar-powered wineries (and Sonoma’s first carbon-neutral estate), they were named Wine Enthusiast’s American Winery of the Year 2013, with writer Steve Heimoff describing them as “a trailblazing producer” that’s been “a Sonoma standard bearer.”

Then of course, there’s the 2012 vintage – critics across the board are calling it one of the best in recent history, so we’d say you’re in for a real treat …

This is luscious Chardonnay was crafted by Rodney Strong’s head winemaker, Greg Morthole, who sourced grapes from the premium Russian River and Alexander Valleys. In the glass, you can expect a golden yellow color with a rich, enticing aroma of stone fruits, pear and melon. The palate is filled with crisp apple and citrus, plus creamy vanilla and toasty oak.

Rich and creamy, this ‘Special Selection’ Chardonnay can easily be enjoyed on its own, though it’s also a perfect match with a variety of foods. Ideal pairings are those that mirror the wine’s opulent, full-bodied character. Delicious with rich seafood pasta, lemon chicken or soft, mild cheeses like Brie or Camembert.

","webHeadline":"Luscious Sonoma Chardonnay","styleName":"White - Dry","styleId":"Wht2","grapeName":"Chardonnay","grapeId":"3","appellationName":"Sonoma County","appellationId":"US0003","regionName":"California","regionId":"015","countryName":"USA","countryId":"US","colourName":"White","colourId":"White","vintage":"2012","smallImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332612_S.jpg","largeImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332612_L.jpg","thumbnailImage":"/images/us/en/product/0332612_T.jpg","lowestPricePerBottle":16.92,"enPrimeurFlag":false,"accolades":[],"vppQualifier":true,"mixed":false},"userItemDetails":{"sortPriority":0,"recommendationTypeId":100,"new":true},"whereUsed":{"inFavourites":false,"inPurchaseHistory":false,"inUserRatedWines":false,"inRecentlyBrowsedList":false,"inRecommendationsList":false},"ratingDetails":{"productRating":{"avgRating":4.3,"numberOfReviews":3}}},{"product":{"skus":[{"id":"sku510164","itemCode":"0533309","listPrice":39.99,"salePrice":39.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":1,"salePricePerBottle":39.99,"vppApplier":true,"vppPrice":35.99,"vppDiscountPct":10.0},{"id":"sku2110256","itemCode":"T0533309","listPrice":119.97,"salePrice":119.97,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":3,"salePricePerBottle":39.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku510176","itemCode":"B0533309","listPrice":239.94,"salePrice":189.94,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":6,"salePricePerBottle":31.66,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku510177","itemCode":"C0533309","listPrice":479.88,"salePrice":358.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":12,"salePricePerBottle":29.92,"vppApplier":false}],"id":"prod410042","itemCode":"0533309","name":"Chateau la Clariere Laithwaite","description":"With 100+ awards (including 18 golds) over 25 years, this family-owned estate's delicious 2009 is not to be missed. La Clarière was the only Bordeaux château to win 2011's Prix d'Excellence at France's top show – so hurry for your top-vintage taste.","longDescription":"

There has been a bitter rivalry between the Bordeaux villages of Castillon and Saint-Emilion ever since they were split apart back in the 14th century. The Castillonais have always maintained that their "terroir" is identical to that of their neighbors. And indeed it is: “If it wasn’t for the political line dividing Castillon from Saint-Émilion, its wines would be twice or three times the price.” (Wine & Spirits)

Over 100 awards (and 18 golds) in 25 vintages … then along came 2009
As you can see, the Laithwaite family's estate has some serious pedigree. Now you can enjoy their barrel-aged 2009 (a landmark year for the region and La Clarière: “This estate has produced a beautiful 2009, bursting with fruit and combining full body with a great freshness of flavor.” – La Revue du Vin de France, 17/20). Today, Tony Laithwaite's eldest son Henry is in charge of winemaking. He's been praised by Robert Parker, and was also recently singled out by Decanter as one of the winemakers to watch in this trendy, top-value corner of Bordeaux.

Le Prix d’Excellence 2011 — only one estate in all Bordeaux is chosen
The estate's wines have been so delicious in recent years that France's most important wine show, Le Concours Générale Agricole, awarded Château la Clarière Laithwaite the coveted Prix d’Excellence, which was given to just 12 estates in all of France (and only one in Bordeaux!). So you won't want to miss out on this amazing opportunity to taste their delicious 2009.

Limited Cases: given all the acclaim, and the wine's cult following, we have just a few cases remaining ... so please hurry for your share.

You’ll taste why with this exclusive Cabernet from the exceptional 2012 vintage. Packed with rich black fruit and smooth tannins, it's ideal with steak.","longDescription":"

Here’s the perfect recipe for a great California Cabernet. Start with Raymond, one of Napa’s most historic estates. Spice things up with visionary new owner Jean-Charles Boisset, head of a top Burgundy house. Steal star winemaker Stephanie Putnam to kick off the new chapter. Then head to select vineyards from Napa and beyond, for premium fruit – in “one of the best vintages California has seen for decades” (jancisrobinson.com).

…Now you can enjoy this sumptuous result. Raymond Vineyards was crowned the 2012 "American Winery of the Year" by Wine Enthusiast. “With recent investments from Boisset Family Estates "the results have been phenomenal", they said. And one of the key investments was the hiring of Stephanie — a past "Cabernet of the Year" winner (The Wine News) who helped build the reputations of top Napa estates, including Far Niente and Hess. She knows just how to craft Napa (and California’s) No. 1 red. And the experts at the 2013 Sommelier Challenge Competition agree – they gave this rich red a silver medal.

Dark ruby in the glass, this sumptuous red offers billowing aromas of black currant, white pepper and warm vanilla oak, with concentrated black currant and raspberry flavors. Enjoy the new release.","longDescription":"

Like all top Chianti winemakers, Simona Barbanera also crafts a small amount of ‘Super Tuscan,’ a mix of Italy’s native stars and international grapes like Cabernet.

Simona’s flagship Vecciano cuvée has been hailed by top Italian critic Luca Maroni as “one of the all-time great Super Tuscan reds” — and your Saracosa is an exclusive (far more affordable) release showcasing the same blend: 60% cherry-laced Sangiovese, 25% firm Cabernet Sauvignon, and 15% soft, plummy Merlot.

Backed by an already-impressive award pedigree of prestigious gold and silver medals, this new, 2012 release is poised to start its own collection of hardware – watch this space for updates …

Wondering what to serve with this delicious selection? You could take a cue from Simona and her family: they like to enjoy Saracosa with the local salami and with wild boar ragù. For something a little more familiar, a rich spaghetti Bolognese will be delicious. Whatever you choose, smooth Saracosa is sure to impress your guests.

“Chablis remains one of the best values in high-class whites.”
– Wine Spectator

It may technically be Chardonnay, but Chablis is like no other you’ll ever taste. Steely, crisp and so refreshing. Even more so in the very capable hands of the acclaimed Dampt brothers. Thanks to our longstanding friendship, they’ve sent us one of their finest from a very special vineyard and the 2011 vintage, whose wines “possess purity and clarity of expression” and have “immediate drinking appeal” (Decanter).

'Premier Cru' is a serious step up from 'regular' Chablis – even steelier, more intense and able to age for a decade or more. Emmanuel Dampt's Paris medal-winner hails from the Les Fourneaux ('the furnaces') vineyard, a south-facing slope that gives grapes maximum exposure to the sun (an important factor in the relatively cool Chablis climate). Because the grapes achieve greater ripeness, they're prized for producing the richest Premier Cru Chablis wines of all. This rare white is a real treat with oysters, fresh asparagus (often a tricky match) or roast chicken – and is a smart buy at today's price.

But do hurry – cases are limited.

Wine supremo Franco Bernabei is the man to see if you're looking for top-shelf Italian wines. Renowned up and down Italy's 'boot' for his winemaking prowess (and nicknamed 'Mr. Sangiovese' by the Italian press), his creations can fetch $100-plus a bottle. With good reason too, as you'll taste with this premium Chianti – a relative bargain compared to some of his other releases.

This fine red was crafted at Fattoria di Lornano’s beautifully restored farmhouse in the premium Chianti Classico region (home of Chianti's finest vineyard sites). Franco worked closely with the Taddei family – who've farmed their land since 1904 – to make the most of the "forward, fruit-driven" (Antonio Galloni) 2011 vintage.

His pick from their property? Their famed Le Macchie vineyard, with its beautifully ripened Sangiovese. Franco aged this classic Tuscan red in fine oak barrels for 12 months, which lends hints of peppery wood to the vibrant Morello cherry and violet core.

The fresh, berry fruit intensity and gentle spice of this wine will pair well with a variety of foods. The Taddeis recommend enjoying Le Macchie with spicy pasta dishes, roasted game or Pecorino cheese. Whatever you decide to serve, get your order in early. We have very limited cases, and this fantastic-value Chianti Classico won't last long.

The Barbanera family’s flagship red is back – and big news. From the excellent 2011 vintage, Vecciano debuted to an astounding 98 Points from Italy’s No. 1 critic, Luca Maroni.

"One of the softest, clearest and roundest wines I’ve ever had the pleasure to experience … absolutely phenomenal.”

This is a classic Super Tuscan, aged 18 months in fine oak. Just to get a hold of this wine is a big deal. But to have it at today’s price? That’s thanks to our customers – a huge thanks from the Barbanera family, for all your business.

Here’s Luca, on what you can look forward to in the glass:

“A wine whose expressive sweetness of vanilla blackberry is in all senses absolutely phenomenal. A Sangiovese/Cabernet blend in which both varieties are at the peak of smoothness, weight and clarity.”

You've really got to to taste this. Very few cases imported (we think Luca took most of what the Barbaneras made!).

It impressed judges at one of France's top shows, winning a coveted gold medal – and its rich flavors will impress your guests too.","longDescription":"

This is just the kind of wine that’s too often overlooked in all the noise surrounding Bordeaux’s iconic First Growths. And unlike those pricey wines, this classic Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon blend from landmark 2009 is already drinking beautifully (a hallmark of the vintage). We're not the only ones who took note of this delicious, small-estate red – Château Grand Ferrand recently won gold at the Concours de Macon … and is sure to be a winner at your table too.

The château is located on Bordeaux's Right Bank, in the coveted commune of Sauveterre de Guyenne within the Gironde district. “Bordeaux Supérieur” on the label is a real quality marker. It means the wine must be crafted from single parcels of older vines, and aged a year prior to release.

This classic, barrel-aged blend centers on Merlot and displays all the rich fruit of 2009, plus silky, round tannins and a lovely, balanced finish. Like all high-quality, young Bordeaux, we recommend you decant the wine at least 30 minutes prior to serving. This is a wine that’s best enjoyed with food – try it with roasted leg of lamb or beef tenderloin.

Top-notch 2009 Bordeaux like Château Grand Ferrand is now in short supply, given such high worldwide demand. Hurry to secure share – we have very limited cases.

A hand-harvested Chardonnay that's overflowing with fresh apple and white peach flavor.","longDescription":"

Bordeaux native Hervé Fabre makes some of our most popular Malbec – but he’s no slouch with whites, as you’ll discover with this latest release.

Hervé lives up to his Winemaker of the Year reputation (2010 International Wine & Spirit Challenge here. He hand harvests the Chardonnay grapes from old, very low-yielding vines high up in Argentina's premium Mendoza region. The fruit that grows here basks in brilliant sunshine by day and very chilly temperatures by night. This combination of elements imparts a succulent complexity and concentration to the wine in your glass. (The vineyard is also sustainably farmed, something the quality-obsessed Hervé insists on.)

This medium-bodied Reserva is overflowing with fresh apple and white peach flavor. And while it's very easy to sip on its own, it's also delightful with a wide variety of foods, in addition to cheeses. Lightly chill then enjoy.

Crisp, unoaked and complex – a classic apéritif that will take you straight through dinner in style.","longDescription":"

In recent years, New York’s scenic Long Island has emerged as a world-class region for Chardonnay. Yours hails from the acclaimed Lieb Cellars and the 2012 vintage, which their winemaker Russell Hearn calls “one of our finest yet.” Pretty impressive, considering how well received previous vintages of Bridge Lane have been …

The 2010 vintage impressed judges at the New York Wine & Food Classic, who awarded it a gold medal (and 91 Points). The 2011 was described by New York Times wine critic Howard Goldberg as "vivacious." Here's the fresh 2012, which also features a tiny splash of Pinot Blanc and Merlot Blanc, sealed under screwcap to “lock in” all its mouthwatering flavors.

Generous aromas of peach, citrus fruits and hints of minerals. Bright and crisp on the palate with vibrant lime and green apple notes. A fresh and lingering finish gives this stunner all the goods it needs to take you from pre-dinner drinks to a meal of seafood or roasted chicken.

Barrel-aged and beautifully balanced.","longDescription":"

This exclusive 'Prestige Collection' Chardonnay is a wine we're really excited about – another stellar find from California's outstanding 2012 vintage …

It's made with the kind of attention to detail and flair you'd expect from Jean-Charles Boisset, Lockwood Estate's famous owner, whose penchant for quality and luxury permeates everything he does. And, thanks to our long-standing friendship with Jean-Charles, you can enjoy insider access to some of Lockwood's top cuvées.

Winemaker Darin Kinzie turned to Vigna Monte Nero ('Black Mountain Vineyard') in the heart of the cool Santa Lucia Highlands for the premium fruit. He then whole-cluster pressed the grapes in the winery (which allows for maximum, yet gentle, flavor extraction), followed by 10 months aging in fine French oak.

This elegant white is packed with crisp, orchard fruit flavors with a luscious, vanilla-creamy complexity – just the right balance of opulence and crisp minerality. So very food friendly, but our favorite way to enjoy this wine is lightly chilled with a generous slice of brie cheese.

Strictly limited cases (160 and dwindling). Order today.

Bubbly and rosé are two very popular drinks these days – here's a fresh NEW find that fits both bills (and is absolutely perfect with sushi take out, cheese platters or served on its own).

From France’s Loire Valley, Abbesse de Loire is made with Cabernet Franc grown primarily around the premium village of Saumur – a spot known in particular for their delicious bubbly. Crafted at one of the region’s top cellars and made in the traditional Champagne method (we're talking major kid-glove treatment at every stage in the winery), it’s a delicately flavored rosé bursting with summer berry flavor with streams of tiny bubbles.

A scrumptious (and wallet-friendly) alternative to Champagne, this small-batch gem is not to be missed if you're a fan of bubbly. Get your orders in before they're all gone …

Don't miss this oak-aged, 92-point 2012 exclusive, which "elevates Viognier into the top echelons of Washington white wines" (Wine Enthusiast). Under 100 cases.","longDescription":"

Legendary Washington winemaker Charles Smith is known for his critically acclaimed reds (like his 97-100 point Syrahs). We've been working with him for years, and here’s a little secret: he also has a special way with whites. As a special thank-you for your support, he’s given us special access to the new vintage of this prized, single-vineyard Viognier. It's rated an impressive 92 Points by Wine Enthusiast magazine, and is accompanied by the below tasting note:

"This brings bracing minerality into the forefront, in a terroir-driven wine with excellent penetration and depth. A fresh mix of citrus and stone, this elevates Viognier into the top echelons of Washington white wines. 92 Points."

Viognier is the rare, highly prized grape of Condrieu in France's Rhône Valley – a late-ripener producing wonderfully aromatic wines with an opulent texture and apricot character. And Charles brings a real artisan's touch to this tiny-batch release. Like all of his top cuvées, it's bottled unfiltered and unfined, adding further complexity and nuance to the wine. Exotic, exciting and mouthfilling, this opulent white can easily be enjoyed on its own, but is also great with a variety of foods (think chicken or seafood dishes with a creamy sauce, or mildly spicy fare like a Moroccan fish tagine).

Less than 100 cases of this rare white are available – so we strongly advise you to secure your share today to avoid disappointment.

Their top Cab sells for $75-plus, and Illustrious is made from a tiny batch that didn’t quite make it into that red. A serious wine, at a fantastic price.","longDescription":"

Napa Valley is home to some of the finest Cabernet in the world. And the 2012s are “filled with oodles of ripe fruit, exceptional purity and fleshy, succulent, mouthfilling, crowd-pleasing personalities” (Parker).

This stunning 2012 is the result of a hush-hush deal with a top Napa estate. Their top Cabernet sells for $75-plus, and Illustrious is crafted from a small batch that didn’t quite make it into this coveted red. In Bordeaux, you’d call it their ‘second’ wine.

So it's no surprise that you'll enjoy all the hallmarks of a first-class Napa Cab – but without the price. Look forward to intense aromas of black currant, plum and spice, with broad, black fruit flavors plus lovely weight and structure on the palate. Light oak aging adds a subtle, toasty note to the long finish.

The concentrated flavors of this fine Cabernet could overpower more delicate foods, so aim to match it with heartier dishes. A juicy steak will pair deliciously, as will roast beef, rack of lamb, spicy sausages or juicy hamburgers. If you have time, decant an hour before serving to release its complex aromas and flavors. Drinking deliciously already, it will continue to evolve nicely over the next 5-6 years with careful cellaring.

Made with old-vine Garnacha from a small family cellar along the famous Camino de Santiago trail, it’s laced with elegant cherry, berry and spice. Tasty with aged cheeses.","longDescription":"

Freshly bottled rosé is a once-a-year treat – and we can’t wait for you to try this elegant Rioja rosado, from the renowned Pamela Geddes and premium, high-altitude Garnacha vineyards along the world-famous Camino de Santiago trail.

Scottish by birth, Pamela spent 10 years crafting whisky, before switching gears to sparkling wine in Australia and Chile and eventually landing in Spain, where she famously made her name with La Pamelita (largely recognized as the country’s first and only red sparkling wine). Equally talented with aromatic whites and fine rosé, she knows what it takes to source the best grapes, for fresh, fruit-filled wines — as you’ll taste.

The fruit for this elegant pink was sourced from Bodegas Leza Garcia, a small family cellar that’s tended to their prized vines in premium Rioja Alta for three generations. At 1,968 feet above sea level, Garnacha’s fruit-packed character takes on a deliciously fresh edge. Pamela chose to give the grapes a light soak (before pressing), to give this rosado its delicate salmon-pink color.

Look forward to vibrant aromas and flavors of summer strawberries, cherries and raspberries, with floral nuances and hints of peppery spice. Delightful on its own, a well-chilled glass will also bring out the best in crisp salads, grilled chicken and fresh shellfish. Or, enjoy it with traditional Spanish cheeses, like Mahón or Cabra al Vino (Drunken Goat).

Brimming with lemon and green apple, framed by white blossom and mineral notes.","longDescription":"

On the trail of the freshest Pinot Grigio

The world has gone crazy for the pure flavors and thrilling refreshment of Pinot Grigio. With its cool alpine breezes and abundant sunshine, northern Italy’s Veneto region is where the revolution began. It’s the grape’s original heartland and still the source of the most crowd-pleasing, breezy Pinot Grigio on the planet – as you’ll taste.

The handiwork of local star (and Pinot Grigio supremo) Giuseppe Secchi, Sentiero dei Pini is named after a spectacular and precious vineyard. This iconic, cone-shaped site was once home to an ancient Roman temple, approached via a spiraling path lined with pine trees (‘Sentiero dei Pini’ means ‘trail of the pines’). The site also provided the perfect vantage point for advancing Roman legions, as their last point of call before heading deep into the mountain terrain. Today, this special plot is occupied by Pinot Grigio vines that yield whites as fresh as an alpine stream.

This is classic northern Italian Pinot Grigio. Aromas of sliced lemon, green apple and white blossom on the nose give way to refreshing citrus and stone fruit flavors, framed by mineral notes, hints of fresh flowers and pleasing acidity.

A lovely aperitivo, this is the perfect partner for antipasti, fresh seafood, crisp salads and more.

Velvety, smooth and so easy-drinking, we think this will be a new favorite among Malbec die-hards.","longDescription":"

Spurred on by feverish demand, winemakers around the world are competing to get their Malbec into your glass. As you’ll taste here, Spain’s Tomás Buendía has a serious quality advantage.

His family vineyard, located just south of Madrid, is perched over 2,500 feet up (that’s higher than many vineyards in Argentina). At this height, his Malbec grapes are buffeted by chilly winds at night and baked in the hot sun all day, which yields wines with wonderfully vibrant aromas and flavors of blackberry, plum, blueberry and more.

The intensity of these grapes was so lovely, Tomás chose to leave Escudo de Oro (which means ‘golden shield’) unoaked – letting all that pure and juicy black-fruit flavor shine through in your glass. Velvety and rich, this is a top pick for meaty steaks or lamb chops.

Since Tomás is already having a hard time keeping up with demand, you may want to stock up while our first cases last – especially at this price.

From the pioneering Valle estate, this seafood-ready discovery is a must-try for any fan of fresh, invigorating whites.","longDescription":"

Pinot Grigio is one of the world’s most popular whites. The freshest, most elegant examples come from the grape’s spiritual home, the Friuli region of northeastern Italy – and “the Colli Orientali hills are home to some of Friuli's most prestigious vineyards,” says wine-searcher.com. From the renowned Valle estate, this discovery is a must-try for any fan of classic Italian Pinot Grigio or crisp, invigorating whites.

To craft it, the talented Paolo Valle teamed up with the equally remarkable Alessandro Gallici, the maker of our wildly popular Visionario. In their hilly vineyards, not far from the centuries-old Rozzato Abbey, Paolo and Alessandro chose to put quality over quantity, putting in place a higher-density vine training setup than some of their neighbors (a vineyard trick that pushes grapes to develop extra flavor intensity).

Beyond the mountain-freshness naturally imparted to the wines by the Alpine terroir, Paolo and Alessandro also chose to cool-ferment the wine in stainless steel tanks – a means of preserving refreshing, pure-fruited character that, decades ago, the Valle estate helped to pioneer in the region.

Expect world-class quality in the glass, including that level of complexity that you only get in the very best Italian Pinot Grigios. Enjoy delicate aromas of pear and peach, with a hint of almond. More orchard fruit unfolds on the palate, framed by well-balanced acidity and a crisp, refreshing texture.

This bona-fide crowd pleaser (and chic aperitif) will be outstanding with lightly grilled shellfish, sushi and sashimi, or a bowl of traditional northern Italian seafood risotto. It’s also excellent with a simple spread of creamy cheeses, dried fruits, nuts and crostini, or any dish involving roasted white meats.

Very few cases imported. Order now.

Sporting a coveted regional gold and full of ripe red and black fruit, Audrey Françon-Formosa’s delightful Grenache-Syrah is a cut above the rest.","longDescription":"

As savvy wine drinkers know, ‘Côtes-du-Rhône Villages’ on the label is a sign of first-rate quality in the bottle. Large parts of this appellation (a step up from regular ‘Côtes-du-Rhône’) enjoy the same ideal soil and climate conditions as the southern Rhône’s most famous, expensive appellation, Châteauneuf-du-Pape. You enjoy flavor-packed wines – made with the same Châteauneuf grape varieties – that overdeliver on value.

For this gold-medal-winning 2011 (Concours des Vins Foire d’Avignon), local star Audrey Françon-Formosa hand-selected a premium blend of 60 percent Grenache and 40 percent Syrah, from premium mountainside plots just north of Vaucluse, near the famous L’Enclave des Papes (‘The Enclave of the Popes’) area. Wines have been made here for centuries, and during the Middle Ages, the village of Cairanne traded hands from the Knights Templar to Pope Jean XXII, with the benefit to the latter said to have been ‘paid in wine.’

In Audrey’s vineyards (as in much of Côtes-du-Rhône-Villages), famous Châteauneuf-style galet stones act as natural vine radiators. They trap heat during the day and release it to the vines at night, helping to ripen grapes to perfection. Here, the Grenache adds a plump red fruit character, while the Syrah introduces succulent black fruit and a savory, spicy edge.

Look forward to a deep ruby-purple color, with expressive aromas and flavors of black and red fruits, coffee and leather. A velvety texture and silky tannins make this the perfect partner for hearty roast game (a favorite in the Rhône), juicy rack of lamb, and more.

And they’ve proved it with their exclusive, first-ever release from the Russian River’s chic Chalk Hill (and stellar 2013). A serious find for Chardonnay fans.","longDescription":"

DeLoach Vineyards is considered “one of California’s best producers of Chardonnay” by Wine Spectator, and they’ve nabbed Wine & Spirits’ Winery of the Year crown an astonishing 12 times. So when they offered us exclusive dibs on their first-ever Chalk Hill Chardonnay, we happily took the whole lot. (And we think you’ll be glad we did, after you taste it.)

Sonoma’s “Russian River Valley remains the mothership for Burgundian varietals in California” (American Wine). Its tiny Chalk Hill district is prized for producing Chardonnay with both intensity and precision of flavor, thanks to cooling fog that rolls in from the Pacific and its famous, white volcanic soils. And in a stellar vintage like 2013, everything’s dialed up a notch.

DeLoach winemaker Brian Maloney hand selected perfectly ripened grapes from the prime-sited Norris and Piziali Vineyards. Then, taking a cue from his Burgundian counterparts, he barrel fermented the juice, imparting complex layers of butterscotch and toast to waves of bright citrus. The finish is long and creamy.

This deserves a spot front and center on your dinner table (especially if you’re serving turkey or ham). Considering you won’t find this anywhere else and that Brian only made about 500 cases, we highly recommend you order soon.

There's deep, dark Waxed Bat, a "smooth yet bold" California gold medalist, a "superb" Italian white and more. Get three of each for JUST $12 a bottle (but be quick).","longDescription":"

The winemakers we work with win tons of awards at important wine competitions (and high scores from top critics). But do you know what they like the most? Hearing that customers really love their wines. Your 15-bottle collection is packed with the most highly rated wines on laithwaiteswine.com – and it comes with a special $59 holiday savings.

Argentine legend Opi Sadler's deep, dark Waxed Bat is "just awesome … my favorite wine" – a sentiment echoed by other reviews of the 2013 edition. From California, Reed Renaudin's San Francisco gold medalist delivers mouthfuls of ripe, black cherry fruit and toasty oak ("my favorite so far," says one fan). And Aussie star Alan Kennett's inky-purple Black Stump is both "phenomenal" and "absolutely scrumptious."

In white, look forward to "top of the line" California Chardonnay, courtesy of 12-time Wine & Spirits Winery of the Year DeLoach and the superb 2012 vintage. You'll also have maestro Alessandro Gallici's 'visionary' northern Italian white – a "superb wine for every day enjoyment."

These stellar wines are all delicious on their own, and will also go perfectly with holiday classics like turkey, ham and more. Enjoy three bottles of each in this special collection for JUST $12 a bottle – and view 'Case Contents' for full details on the individual wines.

Don't delay – these stars are sure to be even more popular at today’s price.

He’s still celebrating – hence today’s HALF-PRICE holiday deal on a trio of his luxuriously rich, French-oak-aged Selezione d’Oro.","longDescription":"

Back in May, judges at Vinitaly (the country’s premier wine show) named Angelo Maci their Winemaker of the Year (for the third time). He’s still celebrating – and he’s not one to forget his best customers. Hence today’s HALF-PRICE holiday deal on a trio of his luxuriously rich, French-oak-aged Selezione d’Oro.

Normally $21.99 – today ONLY $10.99 a bottle*

Key to the depth of flavor are Angelo’s 80-year-old Primitivo and Negroamaro vines. Incredibly, each one yields just a single bottle of this blockbuster red (you only have to look at the many 5-star online reviews to see what a BIG hit it is).

We have just a few three packs to share. They’re very likely to sell out. And they’ll ship at no cost when taken with any 12-bottle case. Cheers!

* Limited to three bottles per household at this special price.

Enjoy Our Top Picks of 2014
In 2014, we visited hundreds of estates worldwide and tasted over 40,000 wines to select the very best for you (only around 2% make the grade). What sets a Wine of the Year apart? First, it has to put a big smile on your face. More than that, every bottle left us thinking: “Now that’s a whole lot of wine for the money.” We’re convinced you’ll feel the same – especially at today's price of JUST $12.50 a bottle.

Your star whites include mouthwatering New Zealand Sauvignon and seriously fine Soave Classico (both great aperitifs) – plus rich Chardonnay crafted by a top Burgundy duo and a Parker-praised California star's heady, aromatic Viognier.

In red, look forward to triple-gold Bordeaux, Opi Sadler's signature Argentine Malbec, a fruit-packed NEW French Cabernet and a 'turbo-charged,' old-vine Spanish Granacha.

See 'Case Contents' for full details on each delicious wine and SAVE $46.

Please hurry for your share – we're predicting this will be one of this season's biggest sellers!

And at under $15 a bottle, you're also getting incredible value.","longDescription":"

This year, we've put together an exciting collection of perfect holiday wines. Everything you'll need – from guest greeting to unwinding at the end of a long evening – is right here. And, you'll pay less than $15 a bottle.

Start with a new, vintage Prosecco, overflowing with uplifting citrus and fine, delicate bubbles. Ultra-fresh Argentine Torrontés/Pinot Grigio, premium French Sauvignon and ripe Sonoma Chardonnay round out your whites.

At dinner, you'll want to pour your boutique Bordeaux, or maybe the acclaimed Spanish Gran Reserva. There's also Paolo Masi's classic Chianti and a rich Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon Reserva – each one an ideal match for filet, rack of lamb, or roast beef.

And for dessert, a stunning, late-bottled vintage Port (that will also make a very special gift).

See Case Contents for further details on each of these exciting holiday wines – and do order quickly. Our holiday cases tend to sell out quickly.

Expect extra measures of ripeness and complexity, thanks to a terrific vintage and prime-sited vines. A must try!","longDescription":"

Winemaking Franciscan monks knew it in 1797. Zinfandel-planting Italian immigrants knew it in 1920. And savvy Cab lovers know it today: Paso Robles is “one of the most dynamic wine regions in California” (Wine Spectator).

It’s an exciting time to get to know Paso wines for sure – not only are there dozens of serious, $100-plus-a-bottle wines emerging from top estates, but there are also terrific values to be had. And that’s especially true in a great vintage like 2013. (According to all the winemakers we’ve talked to, 2013 is another excellent vintage for California. High-quality fruit, richness, balance – there’s a lot to appreciate.) And The Holdings is a delicious introduction.

This exclusive release comes from a talented local grower and three, top-sited vineyards in eastern Paso Robles. Look for distinctive blackberry aromas and rich palate, with flavors of ripe blueberry, velvety, polished tannins and a long finish. Drinking deliciously now, The Holdings is best ‘held’ until you’re serving a nice, juicy steak. Lock down your share today!","webHeadline":"Excellent Vintage Paso Robles Cab","styleName":"Red - Full bodied","styleId":"RedE","grapeName":"Cabernet Sauvignon","grapeId":"1","appellationName":"Paso Robles","appellationId":"US0008","regionName":"California","regionId":"015","countryName":"USA","countryId":"US","colourName":"Red","colourId":"Red","vintage":"2013","smallImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_S.jpg","largeImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_L.jpg","thumbnailImage":"/images/us/en/product/0084813_T.jpg","lowestPricePerBottle":15.83,"enPrimeurFlag":false,"accolades":[],"vppQualifier":true,"mixed":false},"userItemDetails":{"sortPriority":0,"recommendationTypeId":100,"new":true},"whereUsed":{"inFavourites":false,"inPurchaseHistory":false,"inUserRatedWines":false,"inRecentlyBrowsedList":false,"inRecommendationsList":false}},{"product":{"skus":[{"id":"sku2690261","itemCode":"0125013","listPrice":13.99,"salePrice":13.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":1,"salePricePerBottle":13.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2690396","itemCode":"B0125013","listPrice":83.94,"salePrice":83.94,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":6,"salePricePerBottle":13.99,"vppApplier":false},{"id":"sku2690384","itemCode":"C0125013","listPrice":167.88,"salePrice":166.99,"preSellOrPreReleaseItem":false,"numberOfBottles":12,"salePricePerBottle":13.92,"vppApplier":false}],"id":"prod2430078","itemCode":"0125013","name":"The Waxed Bat","description":"Argentina’s deep, dark reds are big news right now. Few are bigger than Opi Sadler’s acclaimed blend of Shiraz, Cabernet and Malbec. Packed with black fruit and made for steak.","longDescription":"

The Waxed Bat is always a huge hit with customers, show judges and critics. And today, you get to taste for yourself (if you're quick enough).

Opi Sadler is one talented winemaker. His colleagues have nicknamed him "The Magician," thanks to his uncanny ability to draw out the most magical qualities in grapes – a talent that's helped put the fine wine spotlight on Argentina. His Waxed Bat is even more special – vintage after vintage, Opi conjures up this acclaimed blend of berry-rich Shiraz, inky-black Malbec and chocolaty Cabernet. This 2013 is every bit as sumptuous and dark as his previous releases and (no surprise) is already garnering acclaim from top competitions like the International Wine Challenge.

A single sip will reveal why Decanter World Wine Awards judges described past vintages as “so thick you could paint with it.” Expect a deep, dark glassful, starting with aromas of lush blackberry and notes of violet, smoke, pepper and licorice. On the palate, layers of rich black fruit flavor and oaky complexity. Look for that trademark long, smooth finish. Delicious with a big, juicy cut of steak.

Another Opi trademark? Small batches. Which means we recommend you get your share ordered today.

Made with premium Snipes Mountain fruit, this rich Cab is not to be missed.","longDescription":"

Cellar-worthy NEW exclusive from the King of Washington Wine

Charles Smith is a huge name. “The man is a brilliant winemaker who knows where all the best fruit is hidden,” says The Wine Advocate. Wine & Spirits has named his K Vintners a “Best New Winery of the Last Ten Years.” And, this Food & Wine “Winemaker of the Year” is among the few whose wines boast 99 Parker points. Like his Royal City Syrah, which costs $140 and must be reserved in advance. Then there’s his Cabernet, described by the UK Press Association as “too good to share.”

When we first tried Charles’ wines in 2009 (from barrels in his garage), we knew they were fantastic values. At that time he didn’t do exclusive labels. He does now, but only for us – and they’re always a big hit. Made with world-class fruit from premium Snipes Mountain, this age-worthy 2012 may be his best Cab yet – 90 Points from Wine Spectator makes our case on that claim. Along with this delicious-sounding tasting note:

Focused, complex and inviting, with green olive, sassafras and coffee accents to the blackberry and currant fruit, mingling effortlessly against refined tannins on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2020.

Decant to unleash the full range of intense black-fruit flavors, then serve with a special dinner (Charles recommends succulent roast beef). Enjoy now, or to 2019.

Guaranteed to sell fast. Order now.

Look forward to dark, sun-baked fruit with hints of freshly brewed coffee and toasty oak.","longDescription":"

“Paolo Masi makes wines with irreproachably clean fruit and abundant personality,” says top Italian wine guide Gambero Rosso. His "lipsmacking, amazing value" Super Tuscan is made in small quantities – so we snapped up all we could of his delicious 2011.

The ambitious, quality-driven Paolo Masi is definitely at the top of his game, with plaudits from major critics like Robert Parker. And thanks to a 20-plus-year relationship with his family’s small estate, you enjoy exclusive access to his small-batch "Super Tuscan." This rich style blends native Tuscan grapes with international varieties like Cabernet Sauvignon. Acclaimed wine writer Natalie MacLean called Paolo's 2007 blend of half Sangiovese and half Cabernet "lipsmacking delicious. Such an amazing wine for the money." Thanks to another great vintage in Tuscany, you can expect more of the same from this 2011.

The wine’s name, "Verso Cielo," is a nod to Paolo's special vineyards, which he planted "facing skyward" in the hills of the premium Chianti sub-zone, Rufina. This ideal exposure helps grapes soak up lots of sun, which yields fuller, more robust flavors in the glass. A generous, 14-month slumber in fine oak adds even greater complexity. Look for deep aromas and flavors of sun-baked raisin and blackberry – plus notes of black currant, strawberry and hints of freshly brewed coffee and toasty oak.

Paolo only makes a few barrels of this special red – so early orders are highly recommended.

Without question, the crown jewel of the southern Rhône is the village of Châteauneuf-du-Pape. Its legendary reds are the kind of powerful yet elegant wines that inspire a life-long devotion (just ask Robert Parker, who fell in love with wine after a bottle of Châteauneuf).

If you haven’t tried one, now is the time. The Rhône has been on a roll with a string of great vintages, most recently near-perfect, 98-point (Wine Spectator) 2010 – one of “the two greatest vintages I have ever tasted in thirty-three years of visiting the region,” says Robert Parker. Speaking of the top critic’s favorite spots, he has high praise for the renowned estate that made this beauty: "Domaine de Nalys is excellent — its reds are disarmingly lush, seductive and delicious.”

Made with all thirteen permitted Châteauneuf grape varieties, this special cuvée fits the bill perfectly. Get ready for exceptional flavor complexity — rich, silky red and black fruit (raspberries, blackberries, cherries) layered with delicate spice nuances, followed by a long, satiny finish. A guaranteed big hit – enjoy now, or to 2017.

Don’t miss Aldo’s world-class Chardonnay Reserva.","longDescription":"

“Aldo Olivier’s Viña Falernia is a pioneering, maverick winery, single-handedly responsible for putting Elqui on Chile’s fine-wine map.” (Peter Richards, Wines of Chile)

High praise for sure. Almost as high as Aldo’s remote Elqui Valley vineyards. They’re some of the world’s tallest (at 6,000 ft.). And at those heights, brilliant sunshine and the cooling influence of the famous Humboldt Current (from the nearby Pacific Ocean) add remarkable flavor intensity and a mountain-fresh zing to his Chardonnay.

Aldo’s trophy cabinet is pretty tall too — it needs to be, in order to house all his accolades. Recent additions include Trophy and gold from the all-important Decanter World Wine Awards in 2012. You’ll also find ‘Best in Show’ titles from the Wines of Chile Awards and dozens of other gold medals.

See for yourself what the buzz is all about. Crafted with premium fruit from Aldo’s special Titon Vineyard (one of the coolest in Elqui), this wine is brimming with enticing papaya and vanilla, with a round, creamy finish (courtesy of six months in fine French oak). Serve lightly chilled and enjoy with roast chicken, grilled salmon, or a spread of creamy aged cheeses.

Rare value on a world-class, single-vineyard Chardonnay. Order now.

Rodney Strong Vineyards is on a roll.

First, there’s the estate itself. On top of being one of the world’s largest solar-powered wineries (and Sonoma’s first carbon-neutral estate), they were named Wine Enthusiast’s American Winery of the Year 2013, with writer Steve Heimoff describing them as “a trailblazing producer” that’s been “a Sonoma standard bearer.”

Then of course, there’s the 2012 vintage – critics across the board are calling it one of the best in recent history, so we’d say you’re in for a real treat …

This is luscious Chardonnay was crafted by Rodney Strong’s head winemaker, Greg Morthole, who sourced grapes from the premium Russian River and Alexander Valleys. In the glass, you can expect a golden yellow color with a rich, enticing aroma of stone fruits, pear and melon. The palate is filled with crisp apple and citrus, plus creamy vanilla and toasty oak.

Rich and creamy, this ‘Special Selection’ Chardonnay can easily be enjoyed on its own, though it’s also a perfect match with a variety of foods. Ideal pairings are those that mirror the wine’s opulent, full-bodied character. Delicious with rich seafood pasta, lemon chicken or soft, mild cheeses like Brie or Camembert.

There has been a bitter rivalry between the Bordeaux villages of Castillon and Saint-Emilion ever since they were split apart back in the 14th century. The Castillonais have always maintained that their "terroir" is identical to that of their neighbors. And indeed it is: “If it wasn’t for the political line dividing Castillon from Saint-Émilion, its wines would be twice or three times the price.” (Wine & Spirits)

Over 100 awards (and 18 golds) in 25 vintages … then along came 2009
As you can see, the Laithwaite family's estate has some serious pedigree. Now you can enjoy their barrel-aged 2009 (a landmark year for the region and La Clarière: “This estate has produced a beautiful 2009, bursting with fruit and combining full body with a great freshness of flavor.” – La Revue du Vin de France, 17/20). Today, Tony Laithwaite's eldest son Henry is in charge of winemaking. He's been praised by Robert Parker, and was also recently singled out by Decanter as one of the winemakers to watch in this trendy, top-value corner of Bordeaux.

Le Prix d’Excellence 2011 — only one estate in all Bordeaux is chosen
The estate's wines have been so delicious in recent years that France's most important wine show, Le Concours Générale Agricole, awarded Château la Clarière Laithwaite the coveted Prix d’Excellence, which was given to just 12 estates in all of France (and only one in Bordeaux!). So you won't want to miss out on this amazing opportunity to taste their delicious 2009.

Limited Cases: given all the acclaim, and the wine's cult following, we have just a few cases remaining ... so please hurry for your share.

Here’s the perfect recipe for a great California Cabernet. Start with Raymond, one of Napa’s most historic estates. Spice things up with visionary new owner Jean-Charles Boisset, head of a top Burgundy house. Steal star winemaker Stephanie Putnam to kick off the new chapter. Then head to select vineyards from Napa and beyond, for premium fruit – in “one of the best vintages California has seen for decades” (jancisrobinson.com).

…Now you can enjoy this sumptuous result. Raymond Vineyards was crowned the 2012 "American Winery of the Year" by Wine Enthusiast. “With recent investments from Boisset Family Estates "the results have been phenomenal", they said. And one of the key investments was the hiring of Stephanie — a past "Cabernet of the Year" winner (The Wine News) who helped build the reputations of top Napa estates, including Far Niente and Hess. She knows just how to craft Napa (and California’s) No. 1 red. And the experts at the 2013 Sommelier Challenge Competition agree – they gave this rich red a silver medal.

Dark ruby in the glass, this sumptuous red offers billowing aromas of black currant, white pepper and warm vanilla oak, with concentrated black currant and raspberry flavors. Like all top Chianti winemakers, Simona Barbanera also crafts a small amount of ‘Super Tuscan,’ a mix of Italy’s native stars and international grapes like Cabernet.

Simona’s flagship Vecciano cuvée has been hailed by top Italian critic Luca Maroni as “one of the all-time great Super Tuscan reds” — and your Saracosa is an exclusive (far more affordable) release showcasing the same blend: 60% cherry-laced Sangiovese, 25% firm Cabernet Sauvignon, and 15% soft, plummy Merlot.

Backed by an already-impressive award pedigree of prestigious gold and silver medals, this new, 2012 release is poised to start its own collection of hardware – watch this space for updates …

Wondering what to serve with this delicious selection? You could take a cue from Simona and her family: they like to enjoy Saracosa with the local salami and with wild boar ragù. For something a little more familiar, a rich spaghetti Bolognese will be delicious. Whatever you choose, smooth Saracosa is sure to impress your guests.

Very imited cases.","longDescription":"

“Chablis remains one of the best values in high-class whites.”
– Wine Spectator

It may technically be Chardonnay, but Chablis is like no other you’ll ever taste. Steely, crisp and so refreshing. Even more so in the very capable hands of the acclaimed Dampt brothers. Thanks to our longstanding friendship, they’ve sent us one of their finest from a very special vineyard and the 2011 vintage, whose wines “possess purity and clarity of expression” and have “immediate drinking appeal” (Decanter).

'Premier Cru' is a serious step up from 'regular' Chablis – even steelier, more intense and able to age for a decade or more. Emmanuel Dampt's Paris medal-winner hails from the Les Fourneaux ('the furnaces') vineyard, a south-facing slope that gives grapes maximum exposure to the sun (an important factor in the relatively cool Chablis climate). Because the grapes achieve greater ripeness, they're prized for producing the richest Premier Cru Chablis wines of all. This rare white is a real treat with oysters, fresh asparagus (often a tricky match) or roast chicken – and is a smart buy at today's price.

But do hurry – cases are limited.

He crafted this great-value red at the Taddei family's historic estate in the premium Chianti Classico region. Aged 12 months in oak, it's packed with juicy Morello cherry.","longDescription":"

Wine supremo Franco Bernabei is the man to see if you're looking for top-shelf Italian wines. Renowned up and down Italy's 'boot' for his winemaking prowess (and nicknamed 'Mr. Sangiovese' by the Italian press), his creations can fetch $100-plus a bottle. With good reason too, as you'll taste with this premium Chianti – a relative bargain compared to some of his other releases.

This fine red was crafted at Fattoria di Lornano’s beautifully restored farmhouse in the premium Chianti Classico region (home of Chianti's finest vineyard sites). Franco worked closely with the Taddei family – who've farmed their land since 1904 – to make the most of the "forward, fruit-driven" (Antonio Galloni) 2011 vintage.

His pick from their property? Their famed Le Macchie vineyard, with its beautifully ripened Sangiovese. Franco aged this classic Tuscan red in fine oak barrels for 12 months, which lends hints of peppery wood to the vibrant Morello cherry and violet core.

The fresh, berry fruit intensity and gentle spice of this wine will pair well with a variety of foods. The Taddeis recommend enjoying Le Macchie with spicy pasta dishes, roasted game or Pecorino cheese. Whatever you decide to serve, get your order in early. We have very limited cases, and this fantastic-value Chianti Classico won't last long.

"One of the softest, clearest and roundest wines I’ve ever had the pleasure to experience … absolutely phenomenal.”

Here’s Luca, on what you can look forward to in the glass:

“A wine whose expressive sweetness of vanilla blackberry is in all senses absolutely phenomenal. A Sangiovese/Cabernet blend in which both varieties are at the peak of smoothness, weight and clarity.”

You've really got to to taste this. Very few cases imported (we think Luca took most of what the Barbaneras made!).

It impressed judges at one of France's top shows, winning a coveted gold medal – and its rich flavors will impress your guests too.","longDescription":"

This is just the kind of wine that’s too often overlooked in all the noise surrounding Bordeaux’s iconic First Growths. And unlike those pricey wines, this classic Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon blend from landmark 2009 is already drinking beautifully (a hallmark of the vintage). We're not the only ones who took note of this delicious, small-estate red – Château Grand Ferrand recently won gold at the Concours de Macon … and is sure to be a winner at your table too.

The château is located on Bordeaux's Right Bank, in the coveted commune of Sauveterre de Guyenne within the Gironde district. “Bordeaux Supérieur” on the label is a real quality marker. It means the wine must be crafted from single parcels of older vines, and aged a year prior to release.

This classic, barrel-aged blend centers on Merlot and displays all the rich fruit of 2009, plus silky, round tannins and a lovely, balanced finish. Like all high-quality, young Bordeaux, we recommend you decant the wine at least 30 minutes prior to serving. This is a wine that’s best enjoyed with food – try it with roasted leg of lamb or beef tenderloin.

Top-notch 2009 Bordeaux like Château Grand Ferrand is now in short supply, given such high worldwide demand. Hurry to secure share – we have very limited cases.

A hand-harvested Chardonnay that's overflowing with fresh apple and white peach flavor.","longDescription":"

Bordeaux native Hervé Fabre makes some of our most popular Malbec – but he’s no slouch with whites, as you’ll discover with this latest release.

Hervé lives up to his Winemaker of the Year reputation (2010 International Wine & Spirit Challenge here. He hand harvests the Chardonnay grapes from old, very low-yielding vines high up in Argentina's premium Mendoza region. The fruit that grows here basks in brilliant sunshine by day and very chilly temperatures by night. This combination of elements imparts a succulent complexity and concentration to the wine in your glass. (The vineyard is also sustainably farmed, something the quality-obsessed Hervé insists on.)

This medium-bodied Reserva is overflowing with fresh apple and white peach flavor. And while it's very easy to sip on its own, it's also delightful with a wide variety of foods, in addition to cheeses. Lightly chill then enjoy.

Their wines are enjoyed at Tom Colicchio’s top-rated restaurants, by New York Times critics and now you! Crisp, unoaked and complex – a classic apéritif that will take you straight through dinner in style.","longDescription":"

In recent years, New York’s scenic Long Island has emerged as a world-class region for Chardonnay. Yours hails from the acclaimed Lieb Cellars and the 2012 vintage, which their winemaker Russell Hearn calls “one of our finest yet.” Pretty impressive, considering how well received previous vintages of Bridge Lane have been …

The 2010 vintage impressed judges at the New York Wine & Food Classic, who awarded it a gold medal (and 91 Points). The 2011 was described by New York Times wine critic Howard Goldberg as "vivacious." Here's the fresh 2012, which also features a tiny splash of Pinot Blanc and Merlot Blanc, sealed under screwcap to “lock in” all its mouthwatering flavors.

Generous aromas of peach, citrus fruits and hints of minerals. Bright and crisp on the palate with vibrant lime and green apple notes. A fresh and lingering finish gives this stunner all the goods it needs to take you from pre-dinner drinks to a meal of seafood or roasted chicken.

Barrel-aged and beautifully balanced.","longDescription":"

This exclusive 'Prestige Collection' Chardonnay is a wine we're really excited about – another stellar find from California's outstanding 2012 vintage …

It's made with the kind of attention to detail and flair you'd expect from Jean-Charles Boisset, Lockwood Estate's famous owner, whose penchant for quality and luxury permeates everything he does. And, thanks to our long-standing friendship with Jean-Charles, you can enjoy insider access to some of Lockwood's top cuvées.

Winemaker Darin Kinzie turned to Vigna Monte Nero ('Black Mountain Vineyard') in the heart of the cool Santa Lucia Highlands for the premium fruit. He then whole-cluster pressed the grapes in the winery (which allows for maximum, yet gentle, flavor extraction), followed by 10 months aging in fine French oak.

This elegant white is packed with crisp, orchard fruit flavors with a luscious, vanilla-creamy complexity – just the right balance of opulence and crisp minerality. So very food friendly, but our favorite way to enjoy this wine is lightly chilled with a generous slice of brie cheese.

Strictly limited cases (160 and dwindling). Order today.

Made using the same traditional method, this find is bursting with delicate bubbles and berry flavor.","longDescription":"

Bubbly and rosé are two very popular drinks these days – here's a fresh NEW find that fits both bills (and is absolutely perfect with sushi take out, cheese platters or served on its own).

From France’s Loire Valley, Abbesse de Loire is made with Cabernet Franc grown primarily around the premium village of Saumur – a spot known in particular for their delicious bubbly. Crafted at one of the region’s top cellars and made in the traditional Champagne method (we're talking major kid-glove treatment at every stage in the winery), it’s a delicately flavored rosé bursting with summer berry flavor with streams of tiny bubbles.

A scrumptious (and wallet-friendly) alternative to Champagne, this small-batch gem is not to be missed if you're a fan of bubbly. Get your orders in before they're all gone …

Don't miss this oak-aged, 92-point 2012 exclusive, which "elevates Viognier into the top echelons of Washington white wines" (Wine Enthusiast). Under 100 cases.","longDescription":"

Legendary Washington winemaker Charles Smith is known for his critically acclaimed reds (like his 97-100 point Syrahs). We've been working with him for years, and here’s a little secret: he also has a special way with whites. As a special thank-you for your support, he’s given us special access to the new vintage of this prized, single-vineyard Viognier. It's rated an impressive 92 Points by Wine Enthusiast magazine, and is accompanied by the below tasting note:

"This brings bracing minerality into the forefront, in a terroir-driven wine with excellent penetration and depth. A fresh mix of citrus and stone, this elevates Viognier into the top echelons of Washington white wines. 92 Points."

Viognier is the rare, highly prized grape of Condrieu in France's Rhône Valley – a late-ripener producing wonderfully aromatic wines with an opulent texture and apricot character. And Charles brings a real artisan's touch to this tiny-batch release. Like all of his top cuvées, it's bottled unfiltered and unfined, adding further complexity and nuance to the wine. Exotic, exciting and mouthfilling, this opulent white can easily be enjoyed on its own, but is also great with a variety of foods (think chicken or seafood dishes with a creamy sauce, or mildly spicy fare like a Moroccan fish tagine).

Less than 100 cases of this rare white are available – so we strongly advise you to secure your share today to avoid disappointment.

Their top Cab sells for $75-plus, and Illustrious is made from a tiny batch that didn’t quite make it into that red. A serious wine, at a fantastic price.","longDescription":"

Napa Valley is home to some of the finest Cabernet in the world. And the 2012s are “filled with oodles of ripe fruit, exceptional purity and fleshy, succulent, mouthfilling, crowd-pleasing personalities” (Parker).

This stunning 2012 is the result of a hush-hush deal with a top Napa estate. Their top Cabernet sells for $75-plus, and Illustrious is crafted from a small batch that didn’t quite make it into this coveted red. In Bordeaux, you’d call it their ‘second’ wine.

So it's no surprise that you'll enjoy all the hallmarks of a first-class Napa Cab – but without the price. Look forward to intense aromas of black currant, plum and spice, with broad, black fruit flavors plus lovely weight and structure on the palate. Light oak aging adds a subtle, toasty note to the long finish.

The concentrated flavors of this fine Cabernet could overpower more delicate foods, so aim to match it with heartier dishes. A juicy steak will pair deliciously, as will roast beef, rack of lamb, spicy sausages or juicy hamburgers. If you have time, decant an hour before serving to release its complex aromas and flavors. Drinking deliciously already, it will continue to evolve nicely over the next 5-6 years with careful cellaring.

Freshly bottled rosé is a once-a-year treat – and we can’t wait for you to try this elegant Rioja rosado, from the renowned Pamela Geddes and premium, high-altitude Garnacha vineyards along the world-famous Camino de Santiago trail.

Scottish by birth, Pamela spent 10 years crafting whisky, before switching gears to sparkling wine in Australia and Chile and eventually landing in Spain, where she famously made her name with La Pamelita (largely recognized as the country’s first and only red sparkling wine). Equally talented with aromatic whites and fine rosé, she knows what it takes to source the best grapes, for fresh, fruit-filled wines — as you’ll taste.

The fruit for this elegant pink was sourced from Bodegas Leza Garcia, a small family cellar that’s tended to their prized vines in premium Rioja Alta for three generations. At 1,968 feet above sea level, Garnacha’s fruit-packed character takes on a deliciously fresh edge. Pamela chose to give the grapes a light soak (before pressing), to give this rosado its delicate salmon-pink color.

Look forward to vibrant aromas and flavors of summer strawberries, cherries and raspberries, with floral nuances and hints of peppery spice. Delightful on its own, a well-chilled glass will also bring out the best in crisp salads, grilled chicken and fresh shellfish. Or, enjoy it with traditional Spanish cheeses, like Mahón or Cabra al Vino (Drunken Goat).

Brimming with lemon and green apple, framed by white blossom and mineral notes.","longDescription":"

On the trail of the freshest Pinot Grigio

The world has gone crazy for the pure flavors and thrilling refreshment of Pinot Grigio. With its cool alpine breezes and abundant sunshine, northern Italy’s Veneto region is where the revolution began. It’s the grape’s original heartland and still the source of the most crowd-pleasing, breezy Pinot Grigio on the planet – as you’ll taste.

The handiwork of local star (and Pinot Grigio supremo) Giuseppe Secchi, Sentiero dei Pini is named after a spectacular and precious vineyard. This iconic, cone-shaped site was once home to an ancient Roman temple, approached via a spiraling path lined with pine trees (‘Sentiero dei Pini’ means ‘trail of the pines’). The site also provided the perfect vantage point for advancing Roman legions, as their last point of call before heading deep into the mountain terrain. Today, this special plot is occupied by Pinot Grigio vines that yield whites as fresh as an alpine stream.

This is classic northern Italian Pinot Grigio. Aromas of sliced lemon, green apple and white blossom on the nose give way to refreshing citrus and stone fruit flavors, framed by mineral notes, hints of fresh flowers and pleasing acidity.

A lovely aperitivo, this is the perfect partner for antipasti, fresh seafood, crisp salads and more.

Spurred on by feverish demand, winemakers around the world are competing to get their Malbec into your glass. As you’ll taste here, Spain’s Tomás Buendía has a serious quality advantage.

His family vineyard, located just south of Madrid, is perched over 2,500 feet up (that’s higher than many vineyards in Argentina). At this height, his Malbec grapes are buffeted by chilly winds at night and baked in the hot sun all day, which yields wines with wonderfully vibrant aromas and flavors of blackberry, plum, blueberry and more.

The intensity of these grapes was so lovely, Tomás chose to leave Escudo de Oro (which means ‘golden shield’) unoaked – letting all that pure and juicy black-fruit flavor shine through in your glass. Velvety and rich, this is a top pick for meaty steaks or lamb chops.

Since Tomás is already having a hard time keeping up with demand, you may want to stock up while our first cases last – especially at this price.

From the pioneering Valle estate, this seafood-ready discovery is a must-try for any fan of fresh, invigorating whites.","longDescription":"

Pinot Grigio is one of the world’s most popular whites. The freshest, most elegant examples come from the grape’s spiritual home, the Friuli region of northeastern Italy – and “the Colli Orientali hills are home to some of Friuli's most prestigious vineyards,” says wine-searcher.com. From the renowned Valle estate, this discovery is a must-try for any fan of classic Italian Pinot Grigio or crisp, invigorating whites.

To craft it, the talented Paolo Valle teamed up with the equally remarkable Alessandro Gallici, the maker of our wildly popular Visionario. In their hilly vineyards, not far from the centuries-old Rozzato Abbey, Paolo and Alessandro chose to put quality over quantity, putting in place a higher-density vine training setup than some of their neighbors (a vineyard trick that pushes grapes to develop extra flavor intensity).

Beyond the mountain-freshness naturally imparted to the wines by the Alpine terroir, Paolo and Alessandro also chose to cool-ferment the wine in stainless steel tanks – a means of preserving refreshing, pure-fruited character that, decades ago, the Valle estate helped to pioneer in the region.

Expect world-class quality in the glass, including that level of complexity that you only get in the very best Italian Pinot Grigios. Enjoy delicate aromas of pear and peach, with a hint of almond. More orchard fruit unfolds on the palate, framed by well-balanced acidity and a crisp, refreshing texture.

This bona-fide crowd pleaser (and chic aperitif) will be outstanding with lightly grilled shellfish, sushi and sashimi, or a bowl of traditional northern Italian seafood risotto. It’s also excellent with a simple spread of creamy cheeses, dried fruits, nuts and crostini, or any dish involving roasted white meats.

Very few cases imported. Order now.

Sporting a coveted regional gold and full of ripe red and black fruit, Audrey Françon-Formosa’s delightful Grenache-Syrah is a cut above the rest.","longDescription":"

As savvy wine drinkers know, ‘Côtes-du-Rhône Villages’ on the label is a sign of first-rate quality in the bottle. Large parts of this appellation (a step up from regular ‘Côtes-du-Rhône’) enjoy the same ideal soil and climate conditions as the southern Rhône’s most famous, expensive appellation, Châteauneuf-du-Pape. You enjoy flavor-packed wines – made with the same Châteauneuf grape varieties – that overdeliver on value.

For this gold-medal-winning 2011 (Concours des Vins Foire d’Avignon), local star Audrey Françon-Formosa hand-selected a premium blend of 60 percent Grenache and 40 percent Syrah, from premium mountainside plots just north of Vaucluse, near the famous L’Enclave des Papes (‘The Enclave of the Popes’) area. Wines have been made here for centuries, and during the Middle Ages, the village of Cairanne traded hands from the Knights Templar to Pope Jean XXII, with the benefit to the latter said to have been ‘paid in wine.’

In Audrey’s vineyards (as in much of Côtes-du-Rhône-Villages), famous Châteauneuf-style galet stones act as natural vine radiators. They trap heat during the day and release it to the vines at night, helping to ripen grapes to perfection. Here, the Grenache adds a plump red fruit character, while the Syrah introduces succulent black fruit and a savory, spicy edge.

Look forward to a deep ruby-purple color, with expressive aromas and flavors of black and red fruits, coffee and leather. A velvety texture and silky tannins make this the perfect partner for hearty roast game (a favorite in the Rhône), juicy rack of lamb, and more.

DeLoach Vineyards is considered “one of California’s best producers of Chardonnay” by Wine Spectator, and they’ve nabbed Wine & Spirits’ Winery of the Year crown an astonishing 12 times. So when they offered us exclusive dibs on their first-ever Chalk Hill Chardonnay, we happily took the whole lot. (And we think you’ll be glad we did, after you taste it.)

Sonoma’s “Russian River Valley remains the mothership for Burgundian varietals in California” (American Wine). Its tiny Chalk Hill district is prized for producing Chardonnay with both intensity and precision of flavor, thanks to cooling fog that rolls in from the Pacific and its famous, white volcanic soils. And in a stellar vintage like 2013, everything’s dialed up a notch.

DeLoach winemaker Brian Maloney hand selected perfectly ripened grapes from the prime-sited Norris and Piziali Vineyards. Then, taking a cue from his Burgundian counterparts, he barrel fermented the juice, imparting complex layers of butterscotch and toast to waves of bright citrus. The finish is long and creamy.

This deserves a spot front and center on your dinner table (especially if you’re serving turkey or ham). Considering you won’t find this anywhere else and that Brian only made about 500 cases, we highly recommend you order soon.

Enjoy Our Top Picks of 2014
In 2014, we visited hundreds of estates worldwide and tasted over 40,000 wines to select the very best for you (only around 2% make the grade). What sets a Wine of the Year apart?
